name: places/ChIJm6Ot-gL2wokR_dhO0UGutJ4
formattedAddress: 177 E 105th St, New York, NY 10029, USA
adrFormatAddress: 177 E 105th St, New York, NY 10029, USA

originalText.text: majority of the machines are out of order (consistently) and the ones that aren’t are being used by staff. some machines, are out of order, and are not labeled. half of my clothes MELTED in the dryer, and the woman refused to refund me stating there was a small sign saying to only dry for 5 minutes. firstly, if you know a machine has the potential risk to melt let alone burn clothes why keep it open to the public? And secondly, why not create a LARGER sign so that the public can view during rush hour when machine demand is high. Absolutely terrible experience, $1000s worth of clothes ruined. Will never come again.

And secondly, why not create a LARGER sign so that the public can view during rush hour when machine demand is high. Absolutely terrible experience, $1000s worth of clothes ruined. Will never come again.

originalText.text: a lot of bags in the way- hard to move around. black film (maybe mold) inside of machine detergent dispensers and a lot of machines out of service but have no signs on them. the lady who works there is very nice, however.

text.text: a lot of bags in the way- hard to move around. black film (maybe mold) inside of machine detergent dispensers and a lot of machines out of service but have no signs on them. the lady who works there is very nice, however.

originalText.text:
They have a quick turn around but they don’t actually FOLD your clothes, making a wash and fold pointless. The bigger items are barely folded once over. My socks and underwear all came in a pile. You will have to refold all of your clothes and bedsheets.

I sent in whites / sheets / colors all separately in their own bags and I got them back totally jumbled so you will also have to reorganize it all. It all came back in one hamper that ended up being WAY too heavy (which is one reason I put things in separate bags). I don’t even think they washed my darks separately of my whites. Also, the clothes have zero scent whatsoever so I’m wondering if they even used detergent.........I was on the fence about buying a portable washer but this sent me over the edge.

originalText.text: The woman who works here was very kind to me. Their machines are very good.

originalText.text: Love this place...very nice young lady working there...great personality
